usefulItems: cheese cloth, baking tray, baking paper, large bowl, oven
title: Pollock with Potato and Squash Crust with Chablis Sauce

ingredients.content: Pollock with Potato and Squash Crust
150 g red kuri squash, peeled, cut in pieces (2 cm)
1 tsp fine sea salt, plus extra to taste
30 g spring onions, cut in pieces
2 sprigs fresh dill, leaves only, plus extra for garnishing (optional)

preparations.content: Pollock with Potato and Squash Crust
Preheat oven to 180°C and line a baking tray with baking paper.
Place squash in mixing bowl and chop <b>4 sec/speed 5<b>. Transfer to a damp cheese cloth or tea towel and set aside.

Place potatoes, onions and 1 dash lemon juice in mixing bowl then chop <b>10 sec/speed 5<b>. Transfer to cheese cloth with squash, squeeze out excess moisture then transfer to a large bowl. Add egg, salt and remaining 1 dash lemon juice then mix gently with spatula.
Season pollock with salt and pepper, top each with 80 g potato mixture and place on prepared tray. Bake for 20 minutes (180°C). Halfway through baking time, clean mixing bowl and make sauce.
Place shallot, spring onions and dill in mixing bowl then chop <b>10 sec/speed 6<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add wine, cream, flour and vegetable stock, cook <b>6 min/100°C/speed 1<b> then blend <b>10 sec/speed 8<b>. Season to taste and serve with pollock, garnished with extra dill (if using).

hintsAndTricks: Substitute red kuri squash with squash of choice, peeled, cut in pieces <b>(2 cm).<b>
